## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 154, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 728, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 91]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 136, 554, 155]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 168, 242, 186]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 198, 368, 216]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0\),  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 216, 576, 252]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 266, 230, 284]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[250, 285, 737, 325]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 333, 477, 371]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 393, 384, 411]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 413, 522, 442]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\{2a + (n - 1)d\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 466, 217, 484]]<|/det|>
Geometric series  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 465, 366, 485]]<|/det|>
\[u_{n} = a r^{n - 1}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 488, 416, 523]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 526, 406, 555]]<|/det|>
\[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 575, 586, 593]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 606, 161, 623]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 621, 571, 670]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 700, 243, 717]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 717, 578, 750]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 758, 584, 777]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 785, 551, 814]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
On the axes below sketch the graph of \(y = - 3(x - 2)(x - 4)(x + 1)\), showing the coordinates of the points where the curve intersects the coordinate axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 144, 784, 500]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 616, 146, 635]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 615, 680, 636]]<|/det|>
Hence find the values of \(x\) for which \(- 3(x - 2)(x - 4)(x + 1) > 0.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 616, 920, 635]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 97]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) for which the line \(y = kx + 3\) is a tangent to the curve \(y = 2x^{2} + 4x + k - 1\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The first 3 terms in the expansion of \(\left(3 - a x\right)^{5}\), in ascending powers of \(x\), can be written in the form \(b - 8 1 x + c x^{2}\). Find the value of each of \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 97, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
The tangent to the curve \(y = \ln \left(3x^{2} - 4\right) - \frac{x^{3}}{6}\), at the point where \(x = 2\), meets the \(y\)-axis at the point \(P\). Find the exact coordinates of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 586, 89]]<|/det|>
**DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS QUESTION.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 291, 920, 325]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the isosceles triangle \(ABC\), where \(AB = AC\) and \(BC = 2 + 4\sqrt{3}\). The height, \(AD\), of the triangle is \(5 - \sqrt{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 338, 144, 356]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 337, 920, 371]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the triangle \(ABC\), giving your answer in the form \(a + b\sqrt{3}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 555, 146, 573]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 554, 806, 573]]<|/det|>

<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 785, 804, 805]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 131, 920, 168]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 109]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 121, 379, 140]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 540, 841, 560]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 425, 91]]<|/det|>
In this question all distances are in km.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 95, 922, 165]]<|/det|>
A ship \(P\) sails from a point \(A\), which has position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}\), with a speed of \(52 \mathrm{kmh}^{- 1}\) in the direction of \(\begin{pmatrix} - 5 \\ 12 \end{pmatrix}\).

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 173, 437, 192]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 174, 920, 192]]<|/det|>

<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 539, 692, 558]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 677, 146, 696]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 677, 855, 698]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 677, 920, 696]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 500, 96]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(PQ = \sqrt{34t^2 - 168t + 208}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 364, 576, 383]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 364, 920, 383]]<|/det|>

<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 180, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 71, 922, 106]]<|/det|>
Find how many different 4-digit numbers can be formed using the digits 2, 3, 5, 7, 8 and 9, if each digit may be used only once in any number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 225, 687, 244]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 920, 91]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

Solve \(\tan \bigl (\alpha +45^{\circ}\bigr) = -\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant \alpha \leqslant 360^{\circ}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 104, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 78, 777, 106]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 918, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]
